pages.text: Slimonia is a Pterygotioid Eurypterid from the Silurian of South America and Europe. Slimonia has an unusual square-shaped head with small compound eyes on the frontal corners. Its chelicerae are small and its body is long and bulges at the front. Slimonia also possesses a more derived flattened telson that terminated in a long needle. It was once assumed that Slimonia stabbed prey with its telson.
However, later studies have suggested that the body was not very flexible and that the serrations on the telson were attachment points for setae that would've aided Slimonia with steering.
